body.name: Fitbit Sense 2 Advanced Health and Fitness Smartwatch with Tools to Manage Stress and Sleep, ECG App, SpO2, 24/7 Heart Rate and GPS, Shadow Grey/Graphite, One Size (S & L Bands Included)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 6 hrs 39 mins
features: Learn to manage stress, sleep better and live healthier with Sense 2—our most advanced health and fitness smartwatch.Human Interface Input: ‎Touchscreen

Manage stress and live healthier: all-day stress detection with cEDA and daily Stress Management Score, ECG app for atrial fibrillation assessment(1), irregular heart rhythm notifications(2), SpO2(3), health metrics dashboard(4), mindfulness content
Measure and improve sleep quality: personalized Sleep Profile(5), daily sleep stages & Sleep Score, smart wake alarm and do not disturb mode

Enhance activity: built-in GPS and workout intensity map, Daily Readiness Score(5), Active Zone Minutes, all-day activity tracking and 24/7 heart rate, 40+ exercise modes and automatic exercise tracking, water resistant to 50 meters

Designed for all-day wear: on-wrist Bluetooth calls, texts and phone notifications(6), customizable clock faces, Fitbit Pay(7), Amazon Alexa built-in(8), Google Wallet & Maps (Google Maps on Android only, coming Spring 2023 to iOS), 6+ day battery(9)

Includes a 6-month Premium membership complete with personalized insights, advanced analytics and more (New & returning Premium users only. Must activate trial within 60-days of device activation. Content and features may change)
body.description: Meet Sense 2—the smartwatch designed to help you stress less, sleep better & live healthier. Fitbit is part of the Google family. 1) The Fitbit ECG app is only available in select countries and with select devices. Not intended for use by people under 22 years old. See fitbit.com/ecg for additional details. 2) Irregular rhythm notifications are only available in select countries and with select Fitbit products; not intended for use by people under 22 years old or with other known arrhythmias. See fitbit.com/irregularrhythm for additional details. 3) Not available in all markets. The SpO2 feature is not intended to diagnose or treat any medical condition or for any other medical purpose. It is intended to help you manage your well-being and keep track of your information. 4) The Health Metrics dashboard and the metrics displayed in the dashboard are not available in all countries. This feature should not be relied on for any medical purposes. It is intended to provide information that can help you manage your well-being. The SpO2 feature requires more frequent charging. 5) Requires a Fitbit Premium membership. Premium content recommendations are not available in all locales and may be in English only. 6) When phone is nearby. 7) See bank and transit availability at fitbit.com/fitbit-pay/banks 8) Amazon, Alexa and all related marks are trademarks of Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. Alexa is not available in all languages and countries. Alexa features and functionality may vary by location. 9) Varies with use and other factors. Up to 12 hours with continuous GPS. Get 24 hours of charge with 12 minutes of charging. 10) 6 months of Premium for New Premium users only. Must activate with device. Valid payment method required. Free trial must be activated within 60 days of device activation. Cancel before free trial ends to avoid subscription fees. Requires use of Fitbit app with compatible iPhone or Android devices. A Google account will be required.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best health and fitness smartwatch out there.
reviews.reviewText: After doing extreme due diligence, I pulled the trigger during the cyber Monday sale. It includes 6mo Fitbit premium subscription at no additional charge - important feature to save your learned trends and offer insights and statistics you don't normally have in the Fitbit app without the premium subscription. AMAZING 7 day battery life for a change! Every feature works accurately as designed and specified as I tested the live EKG while at my cardiologist's office and the results were identical. I've been tracking my sleep since my first Fitbit Charge 2 and as old as that was, it was also as accurate. As someone with A-Fib, it saves sessions of arrhythmia in PDF form so I can quickly and easily send it to my cardiologist. During sleep, it measures your heart rate variability, your specific oxygen levels SPO2, your breathing rate in how many breaths per minute and does every single activity monitoring application that all other activity watches do. This is by far the best value for the market. Especially considering that if you were to try and do all day heart rate monitoring and sleep monitoring with an iWatch, it would be dead already while you were halfway asleep. On board it has Google wallet, Google maps and other applications you can add such as find my phone, other watch faces, etc. If you are looking for literally the best watch for the money, features, battery life etc, the Sense 2 is for you! I'm not a bot nor am I paid for this review; just an actual real review by a pleased customer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Purchase - Fitbit Sense 2 Exceeds Expectations
reviews.reviewText: I recently bought the Fitbit Sense 2, and I must say, it's an exceptional smartwatch that has thoroughly impressed me. This device is not just a watch; it's a comprehensive health and fitness companion that stands out in the market.The reliability of the Fitbit Sense 2 is top-notch. It tracks my health metrics accurately, including heart rate, SpO2, and even provides ECG readings. The 24/7 GPS tracking is incredibly precise, making it perfect for my outdoor activities and workouts. It's reassuring to have such reliable health monitoring right on my wrist.What sets this smartwatch apart is its advanced features for stress and sleep management. The tools provided are genuinely helpful and have made a noticeable difference in my daily routine. I've become more aware of my stress levels and sleep patterns, and the insights offered by the watch help me make healthier lifestyle choices.The accompanying app is another highlight. It's user-friendly and intuitive, making it easy to navigate through my health data and set fitness goals. Syncing the watch with the app is seamless, and I appreciate how it presents complex health data in an easy-to-understand format.The design of the watch, with its shadow grey/graphite color scheme, is sleek and modern. It's comfortable to wear all day and comes with both small and large bands, ensuring a perfect fit for any wrist size.In conclusion, the Fitbit Sense 2 is a fantastic investment for anyone serious about their health and fitness. Its accuracy, range of health tools, user-friendly app, and stylish design make it a standout choice. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable and advanced health and fitness smartwatch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Awesome fitness tracker
reviews.reviewText: I have used Fitbit trackers since 2018. I have find them very reliable. The Sense 2 is my latest. I debated over the Apple Watch and the Fitbit. I chose Fitbit again because of the long battery life. I didn’t want to have to charge my watch every day. Since I walk and bike in all types of weather, I wanted a tracker that was waterproof. The Sense 2 does everything I need.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Been holding off for a fitbit with a large strap. Got it!
reviews.reviewText: My old Charge 2 came with an XL band and I had it going for years until I broke the display. I needed a new fitbit but NONE of them had straps or straps available large enough to fit my wrist. I am a large man and needed the XL band that some rocket scientist at fitbit decided they didn't need to offer for a while. Seriously a lot of us big folks use the fitbit to track our progress to not being so big! Please don't put obstacles up! Anyway a friend recommended the Sense 2, and I figured it listed a band the right size so I ordered knowing I could return it if it didn't fit. Well it did, and all functions are as I expect from Fitbit. Now the bad part...The band is made of silicone and DOES NOT allow your skin to breathe. So it holds sweat against your skin not allowing it to dry off, this causes a flaky peeling disgusting rash.Thankfully the aftermarket apparently got on the stick and started supporting large bands in fabric again. So I ordered a nice elastic strap for mine and am tickled silly with it.I have a GI issue that I need to track symptoms, and since I am in the fitbit app already, it would be fantastic if they could offer some sort of freeform tracking / daily health diary in the app so I could track it all in one place.Battery life is good, not great, but good. And in typical fitbit fashion the charging adapter is anything but standard. Aside from those minor quirks though, function is great. Phone notifications are good, text messages are good except when my friends text me pics of dumb stuff...The ability to set the watch face to a design I like is awesome. I went with an analog sport watch face and love it.
The notification is not strong enough which is below my expectation.
Llego antes de tiempo y en excelentes condiciones

Las cosas malas, me causó una dermatitis en la muñeca, la correa es de plástico y no deja respirar la piel; no funciona bien con iOS muchas veces no ves las notificaciones; algunas características no están habilitadas en México. Lo bueno la batería
Lo compré para mi esposa y resultó un producto caro y con muy pocas funciones , prácticamente un versa lite que tenía ella antes tenía más funcionesNo lo recomiendo
